author: Special Correspondent
text:
Hundreds of government employees courted arrest after attempting to stage picketing agitations in Tiruchi and neighbouring districts on Friday as part of the on-going strike by the Tamil Nadu Government Employees’ Association to press for their charter of demands, including withdrawal of the new pension scheme and filling of vacancies.

The striking employees sought to intensify their strike on Friday and a large number of them attempted to stage a picketing agitation in front of the Collector’s office in the city.

About 650 people, many of them women, were taken into preventive custody.

In Pudukottai, 1,200 employees were taken into custody when he attempted to picket the Public Office campus. Traffic was affected in the area for sometime due to the agitation.

About 1,500 government employees, including over 1,300 women, were removed by the police after they sought to picket the taluk office in Karur. Similar protests were held in Perambalur and Ariyalur districts and about 875 employees were taken into custody from the two districts.

Police sources said all the arrested were released in the evening.
title: Government employees court arrest
